links.title: Alan Kurdi: Why one picture cut through
Dispatches: Why I Shared a Horrific Photo of a Drowned Syrian Child

backStory.text: “On the one hand, I wish I hadn’t had to take that picture. I would have much preferred to have taken one of Alan playing on the beach than photographing his corpse. What I saw has left a terrible impression that keeps me awake at night. “Then again, I am happy that the word finally cares and is mourning the dead children. I hope that my picture can contribute to changing the way we look at immigration in Europe, and that no more people have to die on their way out of a war."
backStory.author: Nilüfer Demir

creativeCommons.codeOfEthics: While all photography is interpretive, as a photojournalist I consider my photographs are meant to respect the visible facts of the situations I depict. I do not add or subtract elements to or from my photographs.
creativeCommons.description: A Turkish officer near the body of Alan Kurdi, a 3-year-old Syrian refugee who drowned off Turkey’s Bodrum Peninsula. The body of his brother, Ghalib, washed up nearby. September 1, 2015.
